bibl.title: Vincenzo Ubaldino v. T.W.Lynch. Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Vincenzo Ubaldino, or Ubaldinno, alias Jose Lombardo, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington.

NOW COMES the respondent, T.W. LYNCH, Acting United StatesCommissioner of Immigration for the District of Washington with headquarters at the port of Seattle, Washington, and for answer and return to the order to show cause issued herein requiring said respondent to show cause why the writ of habeas corpus should not be granted herein, says that he here produces the body of VINCENZO UBALDINO or UBALDINNO alias JOSE LOMBARDO, the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction of said order to show cause; and for further answer and return to said order avers that he is detaining in his custody the said VINCENZO UBALDINO for deportation from the United States as an alien Italian person not entitled to admission under the laws of the United States, the said VINCEZNO UBALDINO having been heretofore arrested and detained by this respondent under a warrant of arrest issued by the Acting Secretary of Labor of the UnitedStates, and thereafter having been ordered deported by said Acting Secretary of Labor, said order to this respondent being in the following words and figures, to wit:
In re VINCENZO UBALDINO or UBALDINNO, alias JOSE LOMBARDO, aged 38, single, native of Italy, last entered the United States without inspection at Blaine, Washington, on or about March 1st.

The record showsthat this alien was previously deported to Canada on the ground that he brought a woman into the country for an immoral purpose, etc. (see memorandum at marker in attached file). It is now shown that he re-entered the country without having secured permission to cover such entry. The alien is illiterate. He is at present serving out a fine of $150 for having nrought liquor into the country. This alien appears to have absolutely no regard for the lawsof our country, coming and going at will, although understanding his own status. The District Attorney has been requested to start proceedings against the alien for a violation of Section 4 of the Immigration Act. While the alien is deportable to Canada, in view of the fact that it is best to deport him to Italy.

The charges in the warrant that the alien has been convicted of or admits having committed a felony or other crime or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude, prior to his entry into the United States; that he was illiterate, that he entered the United States within one year of his deportation under the Immigration Act, consent to reapply for admission not having been granted; that he was a person likely to become a public charge at the time of his entry; and that he entered without inspection; having been sustained, it is accordingly recommended that the alien be deported to Italy, at Government expense, his deportation to be stayed until such time as the criminal proceedings instituted against him have been properly disposed of.

Respondent attaches hereto the original record, order, decision and exhibits, both on the hearing before the Immigration Inspector at Seattle, Washington, and the record of the submission of said hearing to the Secretary of Labor, which papers are hereby made a part and parcel of this return the same as if copied herein in full.
WHEREFORE, respondent prays that said writ of habeas corpus be denied.
T.W. LYNCH, being first duly sworn, on oath deposes and says:
That he is acting commissioner of immigration, named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return and knows the contents thereof; and that he believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 27th day of December, 1921.
Deputy Clerk, U.S. Dist. Court. Western Dist. of Washington
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Vincenzo Ubaldino for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
